cloudtrail.name: ct.addendum.originaleventid
cloudtrail.description: The original event ID.

cloudtrail.name: ct.addendum.originalrequestid
cloudtrail.description: The original unique ID of the request.

cloudtrail.name: ct.addendum.reason
cloudtrail.description: The reason that the event or some of its contents were missing.

cloudtrail.name: ct.addendum.updatedfields
cloudtrail.description: The event record fields that are updated by the addendum.

cloudtrail.name: ct.additionaleventdata
cloudtrail.description: All additional event data attributes.

cloudtrail.name: ct.apiversion
cloudtrail.description: The API version associated with the AwsApiCall eventType value.

cloudtrail.name: ct.edgedevicedetails
cloudtrail.description: Information about edge devices that are targets of a request.

cloudtrail.name: ct.error
cloudtrail.description: The error code from the event. Will be \

cloudtrail.name: ct.errormessage
cloudtrail.description: The description of an error. Will be \

cloudtrail.name: ct.eventcategory
cloudtrail.description: Shows the event category that is used in LookupEvents calls.

cloudtrail.name: ct.eventtype
cloudtrail.description: Identifies the type of event that generated the event record.

cloudtrail.name: ct.id
cloudtrail.description: the unique ID of the cloudtrail event (eventID in the json).

cloudtrail.name: ct.info
cloudtrail.description: summary information about the event. This varies depending on the event type and, for some events, it contains event-specific details.

cloudtrail.name: ct.managementevent
cloudtrail.description: 'true' if the event is a management event (AwsApiCall, AwsConsoleAction, AwsConsoleSignIn, or AwsServiceEvent), 'false' otherwise.

cloudtrail.name: ct.name
cloudtrail.description: the name of the cloudtrail event (eventName in the json).

cloudtrail.name: ct.readonly
cloudtrail.description: 'true' if the event only reads information (e.g. DescribeInstances), 'false' if the event modifies the state (e.g. RunInstances, CreateLoadBalancer...).

cloudtrail.name: ct.recipientaccountid
cloudtrail.description: The account ID that received this event.

cloudtrail.name: ct.region
cloudtrail.description: the region of the cloudtrail event (awsRegion in the json).

cloudtrail.name: ct.request
cloudtrail.description: All request parameters.

cloudtrail.name: ct.request.availabilityzone
cloudtrail.description: the availability zone included in the request.

cloudtrail.name: ct.request.cluster
cloudtrail.description: the cluster included in the request.

cloudtrail.name: ct.request.functionname
cloudtrail.description: the function name included in the request.

cloudtrail.name: ct.request.groupname
cloudtrail.description: the group name included in the request.

cloudtrail.name: ct.request.host
cloudtrail.description: the host included in the request

cloudtrail.name: ct.request.name
cloudtrail.description: the name of the entity being acted on in the request.

cloudtrail.name: ct.request.policy
cloudtrail.description: the policy included in the request

cloudtrail.name: ct.request.serialnumber
cloudtrail.description: the serial number provided in the request.

cloudtrail.name: ct.request.servicename
cloudtrail.description: the service name provided in the request.

cloudtrail.name: ct.request.subnetid
cloudtrail.description: the subnet ID provided in the request.

cloudtrail.name: ct.request.taskdefinition
cloudtrail.description: the task definition prrovided in the request.

cloudtrail.name: ct.request.username
cloudtrail.description: the username provided in the request.

cloudtrail.name: ct.requestid
cloudtrail.description: The value that identifies the request.

cloudtrail.name: ct.resources
cloudtrail.description: A list of resources accessed in the event.

cloudtrail.name: ct.response
cloudtrail.description: All response elements.

cloudtrail.name: ct.response.reservationid
cloudtrail.description: the reservation ID included in the response.

cloudtrail.name: ct.response.subnetid
cloudtrail.description: the subnet ID included in the response.

cloudtrail.name: ct.serviceeventdetails
cloudtrail.description: Identifies the service event, including what triggered the event and the result.

cloudtrail.name: ct.sessioncredentialfromconsole
cloudtrail.description: Shows whether or not an event originated from an AWS Management Console session.

cloudtrail.name: ct.sharedeventid
cloudtrail.description: GUID generated by CloudTrail to uniquely identify CloudTrail events.

cloudtrail.name: ct.shortsrc
cloudtrail.description: the source of the cloudtrail event (eventSource in the json, without the '.amazonaws.com' trailer).

cloudtrail.name: ct.src
cloudtrail.description: the source of the cloudtrail event (eventSource in the json).

cloudtrail.name: ct.srcip
cloudtrail.description: the IP address generating the event (sourceIPAddress in the json).

cloudtrail.name: ct.time
cloudtrail.description: the timestamp of the cloudtrail event (eventTime in the json).

cloudtrail.name: ct.tlsdetails.ciphersuite
cloudtrail.description: The cipher suite (combination of security algorithms used) of a request.

cloudtrail.name: ct.tlsdetails.clientprovidedhostheader
cloudtrail.description: The client-provided host name used in the service API call.

cloudtrail.name: ct.tlsdetails.tlsversion
cloudtrail.description: The TLS version of a request.

cloudtrail.name: ct.user
cloudtrail.description: the user of the cloudtrail event (userIdentity.userName in the json).

cloudtrail.name: ct.user.accountid
cloudtrail.description: the account id of the user of the cloudtrail event.

cloudtrail.name: ct.user.arn
cloudtrail.description: the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the user that made the request.

cloudtrail.name: ct.user.identitytype
cloudtrail.description: the kind of user identity (e.g. Root, IAMUser,AWSService, etc.)

cloudtrail.name: ct.user.principalid
cloudtrail.description: A unique identifier for the user that made the request.

cloudtrail.name: ct.useragent
cloudtrail.description: the user agent generating the event (userAgent in the json).

cloudtrail.name: ct.vpcendpointid
cloudtrail.description: Identifies the VPC endpoint in which requests were made.

cloudtrail.name: ec2.imageid
cloudtrail.description: the ID for the image used to run the ec2 instance in the response.

cloudtrail.name: ec2.name
cloudtrail.description: the name of the ec2 instances, typically stored in the instance tags.

cloudtrail.name: ecr.imagetag
cloudtrail.description: the tag of the image specified in the request.

cloudtrail.name: ecr.repository
cloudtrail.description: the name of the ecr Repository specified in the request.

cloudtrail.name: iam.policy
cloudtrail.description: the IAM policy specified in the request.

cloudtrail.name: iam.role
cloudtrail.description: the IAM role specified in the request.

cloudtrail.name: s3.bucket
cloudtrail.description: the bucket name for s3 events.

cloudtrail.name: s3.bytes
cloudtrail.description: the size of an s3 download or upload, in bytes.

cloudtrail.name: s3.bytes.in
cloudtrail.description: the size of an s3 upload, in bytes.

cloudtrail.name: s3.bytes.out
cloudtrail.description: the size of an s3 download, in bytes.

cloudtrail.name: s3.cnt.get
cloudtrail.description: the number of get operations. This field is 1 for GetObject events, 0 otherwise.

cloudtrail.name: s3.cnt.other
cloudtrail.description: the number of non I/O operations. This field is 0 for GetObject and PutObject events, 1 for all the other events.

cloudtrail.name: s3.cnt.put
cloudtrail.description: the number of put operations. This field is 1 for PutObject events, 0 otherwise.

cloudtrail.name: s3.key
cloudtrail.description: the S3 key name.

cloudtrail.name: s3.uri
cloudtrail.description: the s3 URI (s3://<bucket>/<key>).

okta.name: okta.mfa.deny.countlast
okta.description: Count of MFA denies in last seconds

okta.name: okta.mfa.failure.countlast
okta.description: Count of MFA failures in last seconds

github.name: github.action
github.description: The github event action. This field typically qualifies the github.type field. For example, a message of type 'star' can have action 'created' or 'deleted'.

github.name: github.collaborator.name
github.description: The member name for message that add or remove users.

github.name: github.collaborator.role
github.description: The member name for message that add or remove users.

github.name: github.commit.added
github.description: Comma separated list of files that have been added.

github.name: github.commit.modified
github.description: Comma separated list of files that have been modified.

github.name: github.commit.removed
github.description: Comma separated list of files that have been removed.

github.name: github.diff.committed_secrets.desc
github.description: For push messages, if one of the commits includes one or more secrets (AWS keys, github tokens...), this field contains the description of each of the committed secrets, as a comma separated list.

github.name: github.diff.committed_secrets.files
github.description: For push messages, if one of the commits includes one or more secrets (AWS keys, github tokens...), this field contains the names of the files in which each of the secrets was committed, as a comma separated list.

github.name: github.diff.committed_secrets.lines
github.description: For push messages, if one of the commits includes one or more secrets (AWS keys, github tokens...), this field contains the file line positions of the committed secrets, as a comma separated list.

github.name: github.diff.committed_secrets.links
github.description: For push messages, if one of the commits includes one or more secrets (AWS keys, github tokens...), this field contains the github source code link for each of the committed secrets, as a comma separated list.

github.name: github.diff.has_secrets
github.description: For push messages, 'true' if the diff of one of the commits contains a secret.

github.name: github.org
github.description: Name of the organization the git repository belongs to.

github.name: github.owner
github.description: Name of the repository's owner.

github.name: github.repo
github.description: (deprecated) URL of the git repository where the event occurred. Github Webhook payloads contain the repository property when the event occurs from activity in a repository.

github.name: github.repo.description
github.description: Description of the GitHub repository.

github.name: github.repo.name
github.description: Name of the git repository where the event occurred. Github Webhook payloads contain the repository property when the event occurs from activity in a repository.

github.name: github.repo.public
github.description: 'true' if the repository affected by the action is public. 'false' otherwise.

github.name: github.repo.url
github.description: URL of the git repository where the event occurred. Github Webhook payloads contain the repository property when the event occurs from activity in a repository.

github.name: github.type
github.description: Message type, e.g. 'star' or 'repository'.

github.name: github.user
github.description: Name of the user that triggered the event.

github.name: github.webhook.id
github.description: When a new webhook has been created, the webhook id.

github.name: github.webhook.type
github.description: When a new webhook has been created, the webhook type, e.g. 'repository'.

github.name: github.workflow.filename
github.description: For workflow_run messages, the name of the workflow definition file.

github.name: github.workflow.has_miners
github.description: For workflow_run messages, 'true' if the a miner has been detected in the workflow definition file.

github.name: github.workflow.miners.type
github.description: For workflow_run messages, if one or more miners is detected in the workflow definition file, this field contains the type of each of the detected miner, as a comma separated list (e.g. xmrig, stratum).

gcp_audit.name: gcp.time
gcp_audit.description: Timestamp of the event in RFC3339 format

gcp_audit.name: gcp.user
gcp_audit.description: GCP principal email who committed the action
